Remis Auditorium



Family Hero (Le Héros de la famille) by Thierry Klifa (France, 2006, 107 min.). The undisputed hit of the 12th Boston French Film Festival returns to the MFA for twelve screenings. With an all-star cast, this engaging tale about a family embroiled in the entertainment business is laced with humor. Nicky (Gerard Lanvin), a lifelong magician, tries to keep his Parisian cabaret, The Blue Parrot, from closing after the legendary owner dies. The funeral brings together Nicky?s family and ex (Catherine Deneuve). All are in search of answers and a way to forgive when secrets, anger, failures, and passion come pouring out. Variety writes, ?Throw in a jubilantly self-mocking Catherine Deneuve, a cross-dressing Claude Brasseur, and a pulpy Emmanuelle Béart warbling torch songs in English, and what's not to like?? Co-presented by the Boston Jewish Film Festival, whose members receive a discounted ticket price.

For more information, check out:http://imdb.com/title...


As is our custom, John will be holding a meetup sign near the front row after the film and then its off to a local restaurant to discuss.
